column1: Your loved one may have a drinking problem if they: - Regularly drink more than they intended - Cannot cut back on drinking - Spend a lot of time getting alcohol, drinking alcohol, or recovering from the effects of alcohol - Have trouble at work, home, or school because of alcohol use - Have trouble with relationships because of drinking - Miss important work, school, or social activities because of alcohol use
- Consider seeking help from a counselor or therapist who deals with alcohol problems.
- Try to stick with the facts about your loved one's alcohol use, such as specific behaviors that have you worried.
